Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery open vessel, possibly a krater or a dinos; interior: glazed black and ridged; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of part of oval object with scale or feather pattern (possible faded added red dots in most scales) in centre and outer band with zigzag pattern; emerging below on right, possible part of a foot.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The scene might be the confrontation of Herakles and the sea-serpent Nereus, though with no close parallels for the creature's body.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0236) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
